bibl.title: Demarco v. McKay. Statement from the Police Chief
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image.

org.orgName: United States District Court of Washington Territory, Second Judicial District

div1.p: In the District Court of Washington Territory, Second Judicial District, Holding Terms at Tacoma in and for Pierce County
In the matter of the application of Frank Demarco for a writ of Habeas Corpus
To Hon John P. Hoyt Jude of said court.

H.F. McKay Chief of Police of the City of Tacoma to whom the concerned writ is arrested for return there to respectfully and restrained of his liberty by the said H.F. McKay for he the said H.F. McKay alleges that he the said Frank Demarco is as restrained lawfully whiches the true cause of his imprisonment.

That on the 3d day of March AD 1887 in the afternoon of said day took the said H.F. McKay suspecting that the said Frank Demarco was a fugitive from Justices from the state of Texas and that he was charged with the of a in said state and tear he was
